# Draft:Kamlbash Kunwar

----
Kamalbash Kunwar (born 1965) is an Indian Bhojpuri folk singer and elected  Zila Parishad District council member from Buxar simri block, known for his Dugola singing style and for actively promoting Bhojpuri folk music for nearly five decades; he belongs to the Hindu Bhumihar Brahmin community and hails from Dumari.‚Äù he has best connection with Dadan yadav Sanjay tiwari Pawan Singh Khesari Lal Yadav  even pawan singh and khesari lal claims that Kamalbas kunwar is even teaches them too you can check online on YouTube
Career
Kunwar began his career as a folk singer in 1976. He gained recognition for his unique Dugola performances which are popular in northern India. He has won numerous shields and awards at regional folk competitions and has appeared on many Bhojpuri music platforms showcasing traditional cultural music.
Public Life
Kunwar was elected as a member to the Zila Parishad of Buxar district in Bihar. He is involved in local governance and community development activities aimed at social welfare.
Social Work and Advocacy
He supports labor rights and sanitation workers, notably participating in events on International Workers' Day (Majdoor Divas), where he has performed folk songs to honor their contributions.
Sports Promotion
An enthusiast of sports, Kunwar has inaugurated sports competitions such as the 'Chetak Pratiyogita' to promote youth engagement in local sporting events.
Legacy
Kamalbash Kunwar is a respected figure in Bhojpuri folk music and local administration, known for preserving cultural traditions and contributing to social causes.
References
Career
Kunwar began his career as a folk singer in 1976. He is particularly well-known for Dugola, a competitive folk singing style prominent in northern India. Over the decades, Kunwar earned wide recognition across Bihar and Uttar Pradesh for his stage performances, and has been decorated in numerous folk competitions. His active involvement has promoted the traditional music of the Bhojpuri region.[web:3][web:9][web:13][web:15][web:22]
Public Life
Kamalbash Kunwar became a member of the Zila Parishad of Buxar, Bihar, following the state's panchayat elections. His tenure reflects his deep engagement in local issues, cultural preservation, and the promotion of community initiatives.[attached_file:2][web:8]
Social Work and Advocacy
On International Workers' Day (Majdoor Divas), Kunwar honored sanitation and labor workers through performances and recognition events. He is considered a local ambassador for social harmony and unity, using his music as a platform for positive social influence.[web:4][web:8]
Legacy
Kamalbash Kunwar is respected as a custodian of Bhojpuri folk traditions and a leader within his community. His contributions persist through popular musical presentations and grassroots activism in Bihar.
